intro: Guapira sipapoana, commonly known as the Brazilian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically alternate, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Guapira sipapoana thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils.
